snippet: The family of Glen Doherty, one of four Americans killed in the 2012 attack in Libya, is waiting for the C.I.A. to fulfill an agreement made a year ago.
abstract: Payment of death benefits from Central Intelligence Agency continues to be delayed for family of Glen Doherty, CIA contractor and former Navy SEAL who died in 2012 terrorist attack in Benghazi, Libya; fight by Doherty's family has been overshadowed by politics surrounding congressional investigation of attack on diplomatic compound, along with confusion over administrative policies restricting death benefits for CIA contractors who leave behind no spouse or children.
lead_paragraph: The family of Glen Doherty, one of four Americans killed in the 2012 attack in Libya, is waiting for the C.I.A. to fulfill an agreement made a year ago.

headline.main: Family of American Killed in Benghazi Awaits Promised Funds
headline.print_headline: Payout Late in Case of C.I.A. Contractor Killed in Benghazi
